ArticleTitle.sentence: PU.1 (Spi-1) autoregulates its expression in myeloid cells.

event.clue: PU.1 (Spi-1) autoregulates its expression in myeloid cells.

AbstractText.sentence: PU.1 (Spi-1), a member of the Ets transcription factor family, is predominantly expressed in myeloid (granulocytes, monocytes and macrophages) and B cells.

event.clue: PU.1 (Spi-1), a member of the Ets transcription factor family, is predominantly expressed in myeloid (granulocytes, monocytes and macrophages) and B cells.

AbstractText.sentence: PU.1 is upregulated early during commitment of multipotential progenitors to the myeloid lineages and inhibition of PU.1 function in human CD34+ progenitors prior to this upregulation blocks myeloid colony formation.

event.clue: PU.1 is upregulated early during commitment of multipotential progenitors to the myeloid lineages and inhibition of PU.1 function in human CD34+ progenitors prior to this upregulation blocks myeloid colony formation.

PU.1 is upregulated early during commitment of multipotential progenitors to the myeloid lineages and inhibition of PU.1 function in human CD34+ progenitors prior to this upregulation blocks myeloid colony formation.

PU.1 is upregulated early during commitment of multipotential progenitors to the myeloid lineages and inhibition of PU.1 function in human CD34+ progenitors prior to this upregulation blocks myeloid colony formation.

AbstractText.sentence: Since PU.1 expression appears to play a role in hematopoietic development, we characterized the PU.1 promoter.

event.clue: Since PU.1 expression appears to play a role in hematopoietic development, we characterized the PU.1 promoter.
Since PU.1 expression appears to play a role in hematopoietic development, we characterized the PU.1 promoter.

AbstractText.sentence: Here we report that the murine PU.1 promoter, as well as the human promoter, demonstrate tissue-specific reporter gene expression in myeloid cell lines but not in T cells and HeLa (non-hematopoietic cells) cells.

event.clue: Here we report that the murine PU.1 promoter, as well as the human promoter, demonstrate tissue-specific reporter gene expression in myeloid cell lines but not in T cells and HeLa (non-hematopoietic cells) cells.

Here we report that the murine PU.1 promoter, as well as the human promoter, demonstrate tissue-specific reporter gene expression in myeloid cell lines but not in T cells and HeLa (non-hematopoietic cells) cells.

AbstractText.sentence: Deletion analysis of the PU.1 promoter indicates that tissue-specific functional elements are encoded in the -61 to -39 bp and -7 to +34 bp regions.

event.clue: Deletion analysis of the PU.1 promoter indicates that tissue-specific functional elements are encoded in the -61 to -39 bp and -7 to +34 bp regions.

AbstractText.sentence: The first region contains a functional octamer (Oct) site at -54 bp and an Sp1 site at -39 bp.
The second contains a binding site at +20 bp for both PU.1 itself and the related ets family member Spi-B.

event.clue: The second contains a binding site at +20 bp for both PU.1 itself and the related ets family member Spi-B.

AbstractText.sentence: In vivo footprinting assays demonstrate that a hypersensitive band was detected at the PU.1 site in myeloid cells but not in HeLa.

event.clue: In vivo footprinting assays demonstrate that a hypersensitive band was detected at the PU.1 site in myeloid cells but not in HeLa.

AbstractText.sentence: A mutation of the PU.1 site which abolished PU.1 binding caused a significant decrease in promoter activity.

event.clue: A mutation of the PU.1 site which abolished PU.1 binding caused a significant decrease in promoter activity.
A mutation of the PU.1 site which abolished PU.1 binding caused a significant decrease in promoter activity.
A mutation of the PU.1 site which abolished PU.1 binding caused a significant decrease in promoter activity.

AbstractText.sentence: Mutation of the Oct and/or Sp1 site results in a lesser decrease of promoter activity in myeloid cells.

event.clue: Mutation of the Oct and/or Sp1 site results in a lesser decrease of promoter activity in myeloid cells.
Mutation of the Oct and/or Sp1 site results in a lesser decrease of promoter activity in myeloid cells.

AbstractText.sentence: Co-transfection of PU.1 or Spi-B in cells lacking PU.1 and Spi-B specifically transactivated a minimal promoter containing the PU.1 binding site, indicating that PU.1 can activate its own promoter elements in an autoregulatory loop.

event.clue: Co-transfection of PU.1 or Spi-B in cells lacking PU.1 and Spi-B specifically transactivated a minimal promoter containing the PU.1 binding site, indicating that PU.1 can activate its own promoter elements in an autoregulatory loop.

Co-transfection of PU.1 or Spi-B in cells lacking PU.1 and Spi-B specifically transactivated a minimal promoter containing the PU.1 binding site, indicating that PU.1 can activate its own promoter elements in an autoregulatory loop.

AbstractText.sentence: Positive autoregulation of the PU.1 promoter may play an important role in the function of PU.1 in myeloid cells.

event.clue: Positive autoregulation of the PU.1 promoter may play an important role in the function of PU.1 in myeloid cells.
